perturbation.original_text: 12. Governing Law. This Agreement shall be governed in all respects, including validity, interpretation, and effect, by, and construed in accordance with, the laws of the State of Delaware executed and to be performed wholly within the State of Delaware, without giving effect to the choice of law or conflict of law principles thereof or of any other jurisdiction to the extent that such principles would require or permit the application of the laws of another jurisdiction.
perturbation.changed_text: 12. Governing Law. This Agreement shall be governed in all respects, including validity, interpretation, and effect, by, and construed in accordance with principles of contract law, without giving effect to the choice of law or conflict of law principles thereof or of any other jurisdiction to the extent that such principles would require or permit the application of the laws of another jurisdiction.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the explicit reference to Delaware law, the contract becomes ambiguous about the governing legal framework, potentially conflicting with consumer protection laws that mandate clarity in such agreements. This introduces legal risk by weakening the enforceability and predictability of the contract, especially in jurisdictions with stricter consumer protection regulations that might supersede vague contractual clauses. If the contract is performed in another state, like California, it might be interpreted under California consumer law, which gives more rights to consumers than Delaware law. The removal of the specific Delaware law provision creates legal uncertainty and potential non-compliance with consumer protection standards in various states.
perturbation.contradicted_law: State and Federal Consumer Protection Laws (e.g., California Consumer Rights Act, Dodd-Frank Act)

perturbation.original_text: 13. Jurisdiction. Each of the parties hereto (a) consents to submit itself to the personal jurisdiction of federal or state courts of the State of Delaware in the event any dispute arises out of this Agreement or the transactions contemplated by this Agreement, (b) agrees that it shall not bring any action relating to this Agreement or the transactions contemplated by this Agreement in any court other than the federal or state courts of the State of Delaware, and each of the parties irrevocably waives the right to trial by jury, (c) agrees to waive any bonding requirement under any applicable law, in the case any other party seeks to enforce the terms by way of equitable relief, and (d) irrevocably consents to service of process by first class certified mail, return receipt requested, postage prepaid, to the address of such party's principal place of business or as otherwise provided by applicable law. Each of the parties hereto irrevocably waives, and agrees not to assert, by way of motion, as a defense, counterclaim or otherwise, in any action, suit or other legal proceeding with respect to this Agreement, (a) any claim that it is not personally subject to the jurisdiction of the above-named courts for any reason, (b) that it or its property is exempt or immune from jurisdiction of any such court or from any legal process commenced in such courts (whether through service of notice, attachment before judgment, attachment in aid of execution of judgment, execution of judgment or otherwise), and (c) to the fullest extent permitted by applicable law, that (i) such action, suit or other legal proceeding in any such court is brought in an inconvenient forum, (ii) the venue of such action, suit or other legal proceeding is improper or (iii) this agreement, or the subject matter hereof, may not be enforced in or by such court.
perturbation.changed_text: 13. Jurisdiction. Each of the parties hereto (a) consents to submit itself to the jurisdiction of courts in a mutually agreed upon location in the event any dispute arises out of this Agreement or the transactions contemplated by this Agreement, (b) agrees that it shall bring any action relating to this Agreement or the transactions contemplated by this Agreement in a court of its choosing, and each of the parties waives the right to trial by jury, (c) agrees to waive any bonding requirement under any applicable law, in the case any other party seeks to enforce the terms by way of equitable relief, and (d) irrevocably consents to service of process by mail, postage prepaid, to the address of such party's principal place of business or as otherwise provided by applicable law.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the specification of Delaware courts as the exclusive jurisdiction allows parties to file lawsuits in jurisdictions more favorable to them, potentially undermining consumer rights. Additionally, removing 'first class certified mail, return receipt requested' weakens the guarantee of proper service of process, increasing the risk of consumers not being properly notified of legal actions against them, thus violating due process rights under state laws.
perturbation.contradicted_law: State and Federal Rules of Civil Procedure (Due Process Clause)

perturbation.original_text: 14. Waiver of Jury Trial. EACH PARTY ACKNOWLEDGES AND AGREES THAT ANY CONTROVERSY WHICH MAY ARISE UNDER THIS AGREEMENT IS LIKELY TO INVOLVE COMPLICATED AND DIFFICULT ISSUES AND, THEREFORE, EACH SUCH PARTY IRREVOCABLY AND UNCONDITIONALLY WAIVES ANY RIGHT IT MAY HAVE TO A TRIAL BY JURY IN RESPECT OF ANY LEGAL ACTION ARISING OUT OF OR RELATING TO THIS AGREEMENT OR THE TRANSACTIONS CONTEMPLATED BY THIS AGREEMENT. EACH PARTY TO THIS AGREEMENT CERTIFIES AND ACKNOWLEDGES THAT (A) NO REPRESENTATIVE OF ANY OTHER PARTY HAS REPRESENTED, EXPRESSLY OR OTHERWISE, THAT SUCH OTHER PARTY WOULD NOT SEEK TO ENFORCE THE FOREGOING WAIVER IN THE EVENT OF A LEGAL ACTION, (B) SUCH PARTY HAS CONSIDERED THE IMPLICATIONS OF THIS WAIVER, (C) SUCH PARTY MAKES THIS WAIVER VOLUNTARILY, AND (D) SUCH PARTY HAS BEEN INDUCED TO ENTER INTO THIS AGREEMENT BY, AMONG OTHER THINGS, THE MUTUAL WAIVERS AND CERTIFICATIONS IN THIS SECTION 14.
perturbation.changed_text: 14. Waiver of Jury Trial. EACH PARTY WAIVES ANY RIGHT IT MAY HAVE TO A TRIAL BY JURY IN RESPECT OF ANY LEGAL ACTION ARISING OUT OF OR RELATING TO THIS AGREEMENT OR THE TRANSACTIONS CONTEMPLATED BY THIS AGREEMENT.
perturbation.explanation: By omitting the explicit acknowledgements (A, B, C, D) that the waiver of jury trial was informed, voluntary, and not induced by misrepresentation, the contract weakens consumer protection rights. Many jurisdictions require such explicit acknowledgements to ensure that consumers are fully aware of the implications of waiving their right to a jury trial. The removal makes it easier to challenge the waiver, but more importantly, it fails to meet the 'knowing and voluntary' standard required by some consumer protection laws. Omitting this language presents a legal risk, especially if the contract is challenged in a state with strong consumer protection laws.
perturbation.contradicted_law: State Consumer Protection Laws regarding waiver of rights (e.g., Truth in Lending Act implications)
